quick_answer.text: An Old Fashioned cocktail contains about 155 calories, primarily from the whiskey and sugar.

tweaks.label: Use 3 oz whiskey instead of 2 oz

faqs.q: How many calories in an old fashioned cocktail?
faqs.a: Approximately 155 calories for a standard recipe.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in an Old Fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, about 6 g carbs from the sugar; no fiber.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-calorie Old Fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, skip the sugar or use a zero-calorie alternative to drop it to ~140 calories.

faqs.q: What's the alcohol content in an Old Fashioned?
faqs.a: Typically 2 oz (about 1.5 standard drinks) of whiskey, contributing most calories.

faqs.q: Does the type of whiskey affect calories?
faqs.a: Slightly; bourbon or rye is around 70 kcal per oz, but flavored whiskeys may add sugars.
